back.text:
Root: — (particle)
Meaning: Have not?
Pronunciation: Alam
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words: As a particle, it has no derived words.
Example Ayah: أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ

Root: ر أ ي (R-ʾ-Y)
Meaning: You see / have you seen
Pronunciation: Tara
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words:
1. رُؤْيَة (Ruʾyah): A vision
2. رَأَى (Raʾā): He saw
3. رَاءٍ (Rāʾin): A seer
Example Ayah: وَتَرَى الْجِبَالَ تَحْسَبُهَا جَامِدَةً

hint.text: Part of the opening rhetorical question.

back.text:
Root: ص ح ب (Ṣ-Ḥ-B)
Meaning: With the companions of
Pronunciation: Bi-aṣḥābi
Tajweed Rules: Istiʿlā on صَا.
Derived Words:
1. صَاحِب (Ṣāḥib): Companion
2. صَحَابَة (Ṣaḥābah): Companions of the Prophet
3. مُصَاحَبَة (Muṣāḥabah): Companionship
Example Ayah: يَا صَاحِبَيِ السِّجْنِ

hint.text: Refers to the army of Abraha.

back.text:
Root: ف ي ل (F-Y-L)
Meaning: The elephant
Pronunciation: Al-Fīl
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah; Madd Ṭabīʿī on فِي.
Derived Words: This noun is unique to this Surah in the Qurʾān.
Example Ayah: This is the name of the Surah.

Root: ك ي د (K-Y-D)
Meaning: Their plan, their scheme
Pronunciation: Kaydahum
Tajweed Rules: Layyin on كَيْ.
Derived Words:
1. كَادَ (Kāda): He planned
2. كَيْد (Kayd): A plan
Example Ayah: إِنَّ كَيْدَ الشَّيْطَانِ كَانَ ضَعِيفًا

hint.text: Refers to the scheme of the army of the elephant.

back.text:
Root: ض ل ل (Ḍ-L-L)
Meaning: In error, astray
Pronunciation: Taḍlīl
Tajweed Rules: Tafkhīm on ضَ; Shaddah on لِّ; Madd Ṭabīʿī on لِي.
Derived Words:
1. ضَلَّ (Ḍalla): He went astray
2. ضَلَال (Ḍalāl): Error
3. مُضِلّ (Muḍill): One who leads astray
Example Ayah: وَمَا تَضْلِيلُهُمْ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ

Root: ر س ل (R-S-L)
Meaning: And (He) sent
Pronunciation: Wa-arsala
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words:
1. رَسُول (Rasūl): Messenger
2. رِسَالَة (Risālah): Message
3. إِرْسَال (Irsāl): Sending
Example Ayah: أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ

Root: ط ي ر (Ṭ-Y-R)
Meaning: Birds
Pronunciation: Ṭayran
Tajweed Rules: Tafkhīm on Ṭ; Layyin on Ṭَيْ.
Derived Words:
1. طَارَ (Ṭāra): It flew
2. تَطْيِير (Taṭyīr): Causing to fly
Example Ayah: وَلَا طَائِرٍ يَطِيرُ بِجَنَاحَيْهِ

Root: — (plural, no common singular)
Meaning: In flocks
Pronunciation: Abābīl
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on بَا and بِي.
Derived Words: No clear singular form in Arabic usage.
Example Ayah: Unique to this Surah in the Qurʾān.

hint.text: A description of the birds' number.

back.text:
Root: ر م ي (R-M-Y)
Meaning: (They were) pelting/throwing at them
Pronunciation: Tarmīhim
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on مِي.
Derived Words:
1. رَمَى (Ramā): He threw
2. رَمْي (Ramy): Throwing
Example Ayah: وَمَا رَمَيْتَ إِذْ رَمَيْتَ وَلَٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ رَمَىٰ

Root: ح ج ر (Ḥ-J-R)
Meaning: With stones
Pronunciation: Biḥijāratin
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on جَا.
Derived Words:
1. حَجَر (Ḥajar): Stone
2. مَحْجُور (Maḥjūr): Forbidden/blocked off
Example Ayah: فَاضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ الْحَجَرَ

hint.text: The projectiles used by the birds.

back.text:
Root: س ج ل (S-J-L) — word of non-Arabic origin used in Qurʾān
Meaning: Baked clay (hard clay stones)
Pronunciation: Sijjīl
Tajweed Rules: Shaddah on جّ; Madd Ṭabīʿī on جِي.
Derived Words:
1. سَجَلَ (Sajala): He recorded (different meaning; lexical root association varies)
Example Ayah: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا حِجَارَةً مِّن سِجِّيلٍ

Root: أ ك ل (A-K-L)
Meaning: Eaten
Pronunciation: Maʾkūl
Tajweed Rules: Shaddah on مّ; Madd Ṭabīʿī on كُو.
Derived Words:
1. أَكَلَ (Akala): He ate
2. أَكْل (Akl): Eating
3. مَأْكَل (Maʾkal): Food/food place
Example Ayah: Unique usage in this specific context in the Qurʾān.

hint.text: A description of the army's final state.
